contraindications.disease: Oral LD sub 50 sub s are 350 to 400 mg betaxolol kg in mice and 860 to 980 mg kg in rats Predicted symptoms of overdose include bradycardia congestive heart failure hypotension bronchospasm and hypoglycemia
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Betaxolol is a competitive beta 1 selective cardioselective adrenergic antagonist Betaxolol is used to treat hypertension arrhythmias coronary heart disease glaucoma and is also used to reduce non fatal cardiac events in patients with heart failure Activation of beta 1 receptors located mainly in the heart by epinephrine increases the heart rate and the blood pressure and the heart consumes more oxygen Drugs such as betaxolol that block these receptors therefore have the reverse effect they lower the heart rate and blood pressure and hence are used in conditions when the heart itself is deprived of oxygen They are routinely prescribed in patients with ischemic heart disease In addition beta 1 selective blockers prevent the release of renin which is a hormone produced by the kidneys which leads to constriction of blood vessels Betaxolol is lipophilic and exhibits no intrinsic sympathomimetic activity ISA or membrane stabilizing activity

The serum concentration of Betaxolol can be increased when it is combined with Abametapir
The serum concentration of Betaxolol can be decreased when it is combined with Satralizumab
